text: In the chill calm of the winter countryside, sit the two vehicles. A pool of BLOOD oozes from the car like an oil flowing slowly towards the CAMERA.
SARAH, lying in intensive care, broken and bruised but al wired up to all manner of equipment. A heart monitor blee regularly.
JESSICA. Illuminated by five flickering candles on the bi cake in front of her, she giggles slightly as she turns t at someone behind her...

INT. HOSPITAL ROOM - NIGHT ec ECU - SARAH’s eyes open wide. She doesn’t jump. It is as waking from a slumber. She looks around at this strange unfamiliar room, at the tubes and needles in her arms. As she begins to pull them out, the heart monitor flat-li gives off a steady, constant tone. She gets out of bed and we

The entire building is apparently deserted as SARAH emerg her room. She pauses, looking each way, the pure white of fluorescent lights almost glaringly harsh. Suddenly, beyond her, the furthest FLUORESCENT light flic and dies, leaving a gaping black hole at the far end of t corridor. SARAH turns to it, entranced by the shadows. We hear something within the darkness, a scratching sound, t breathing... SARAH backs away.... Another light goes out, the next on extending the darkness toward her, following her as she retreats, walking at first, but when a third light goes o quickens her pace. Again we hear the sounds coming from within the darkness, with her own gasping as she breaks into a run, the light switching off in succession behind her, the darkness purs her along the corridor and catching up. No matter how fas runs, she cannot get away from it, until at last she glan behind her and the light above her goes out! Now she is in the darkness, running after the light. She back. There is a harsh rasping shriek, coming at her from shadows, and she turns back she runs headlong into BETH! SUDDENLY everything returns to normality! They are in a b hospital corridor. All the lights are on. People come and and SARAH is still just outside her hospital room.
Sarah? But SARAH is a quivering wreck, unable to fathom reality, clinging to BETH for support. BETH (cont'd) Doctor? DOCTOR?! We look over BETH’s shoulder at SARAH’s eyes, blank, star
FLYING low across the treetops we follow a CAR, its headl on full beam, winding its way along a deserted road high mountains.
BETH drives. Next to her SARAH, her hair cut shorter, sta blankly out at the passing road. BETH is fiddling with th from which some swampy, twangy music emanates

Its mud, blood and beer... She twists the dial again and we hear the bellows of a pr BETH (cont'd) Or God. BETH switches off the radio. SARAH stares out at the gloo dusk, oblivious. Suddenly an overhanging branch bangs against the windscre startling SARAH. BETH looks at her and stops the car at t of the road. There is that total, rural silence that acco for the in-breeding and the high suicide rate.
We don’t have to do this you know. We can turn back, stay in town, get wasted and go to a barn dance.

Now that is frightening. A motorcycle zooms up out of nowhere, two shaven-headed l guys on it. As their headlights pick out the girls in the stationary car they scream and holler, the back passenger raising a clenched fist in salute. The noise and the bike swallowed up by the gathering darkness.
My kind of town. SARAH straightens up, pulling herself together
You’re right. We don’t have to do this. But I’m not going to be the one to tell Juno... BETH smiles, relieved. She starts up the car and they con on their way.
She’s a piece of work - she always drags us out to the middle of. (MORE)
10 14 12 BETH(cont 'd) She probably bribed someone to get Rebecca and Sam green cards just to make sure we stay on her turf.
She came to England last year.
(mutters) And she left pretty quickly.
Beth...it’s no-one’s fault

The same car drives towards us and pulls over, its headli ECU. We pull back as they switch off and Sarah steps out passenger side. BETH gets out too, stretching. On the veranda in front of this log cabin JUNO waits for
Sarah! Beth! She strides towards them, radiant and confident as ever. sweeps SARAH into an embrace, catching BETH’s eye as she so. BETH looks back at her, cool.
Juno. JUNO holds Sarah’s face in her hands. She’s warm, intense compelling...

Everything’s going to be fine. Better it’s going to be great - go on in, Rebecca and Sam can’t wait to see you. She takes SARAH’s bag and pushes her towards the light an laughter. Once Sarah is out of earshot, JUNO looks at BET JUNO (cont'd) How is she?  13
She’s here. I wouldn’t push it any further than that. Picking up her bag she walks past Juno. BETH (cont'd) I'll look after her.
It’s not a competition Beth.
Sure. And they head towards the door past a large window, throu which we can see women gathered around a roaring log fire drinking, talking and laughing.
Rebecca Van Ney (tall, athletic, Scandinavian, mid 20s) h arm around SARAH.
It’s so good to see you. So good. A smaller version of Rebecca runs into the room.
Beth! Sarah! SARAH gets up to embrace her. It is clear from the expres her face that all the lights, the people, are slightly to for her.
(quietly) Sam. Thank you for your letter, it meant a lot to me.
I’m sorry I couldn’t be there. Mid- terms...
(changing the subject) Sarah, you know Sam’s going to be Doctor Van Ney in like, a year’s time!
Please tell me it’s longer.  10.
I’m going to fix us some drinks - Sarah, come help me? But Sarah is staring into the fire, distracted. JUNO shru walks off. SAM laughs at BETH.
I can treat your arthritis now if you like. I hear it all starts falling apart past twenty-five... BETH swipes at her playfully...
Can anyone make me feel any older? And in walks HOLLY, about 18, in skate clothes, with ring everywhere and spiky hair, smoking some home-grown. She i incredibly attractive.
(european accent) Hello. You are the teacher friend, yes?
Great. Just put me in a rocking chair.
This is Holly. Juno’s...protege.
(mutters) I always thought Juno would eat her young. Rebecca laughs
(SHARP )
I am a little bit tough for that I think.
I’ve heard all about you. You’re the crazy one who jumps off buildings.
(laughing) Base jumping. Buildings, yes. It is illegal. But a high.  14 15 11. She waves her joint and all the girls laugh, tensions dissolving. HOLLY smiles at SARAH.
I like your short hair. It’s better than before. Juno showed me photos of when you used to climb together

(at Sarah’s shoulder) Plus I found this classic, from our first ever trip. She hands SARAH an old slightly battered photo. It shows teenage girls - JUNO, SARAH and BETH - with their arms ar each other, elated, against a blue sky.
God. Check the hair!

The lodge, its windows lit up, looks invitingly warm agai forbidding backdrop of the vast forest. We can vaguely se women enjoying themselves inside, the sound of their laug and conversation fading on the breeze. We HOLD on this fo moment and then very slowly begin to TRACK IN on the wind
The girls are sitting around, relaxed. A large number of wine bottles.
What happened to Josh, Sam, are you guys still together?
Kind of, sort of. Different shifts...
What about you Holly?

I’m like Juno, you know, the sport fuck? Rebecca too I think? But when I am an old lady maybe twenty-four twenty-five I have babies...  12. There is an awkward silence. Rebecca squeezes SARAH’s han HOLLY (cont'd) What?
(calm) I had a child. She died. A year ago. Holly looks at her.
Shit. Juno told me about your husband but I didn’t... No-one can think of anything to say. JUNO fills the silen
(to Sarah) So Rebecca and I are going into business. We’ve set up a company.
A company? How very...conventional of you Juno.

It’s a women-only outward-bound centre. We’re going to do trips all over the country - climbing, caving, skydiving, surfing... She stretches her impossibly long legs. REBECCA (cont'd) There’s a real market for women who don’t want the bullshit that comes with a mixed group.
What bullshit?

(teasing; of Rebecca) Well, there’s the gear freaks. Those guys who have to have the latest gadget and use it all the time. No room for instinct. Rebecca laughs, realizing that Juno’s comment is directed her. She continues the joke  16 17 13.
(of Holly) And the peak-baggers - they don’t care where they are; it’s just about whether they’ve got to the top of enough of them...
(of Juno) And the guys who’ve got to be the leader; who’ve got to hold the map and want to turn the whole thing into the army. I’ve had them.
(to Sam) And the guys who make you the baby of the group even if you’ve done more than them.
(to Holly) See? You just don’t get that bullshit with women. They all laugh.
REBECCA and JUNO are padding around preparing for the mor REBECCA has an impeccably tidy pile of gear at the foot o bed. JUNO a pile of clothes and a map.

HOLLY is lying on her bed while SAM packs. A low lamp is burning. HOLLY is in a very brief T-shirt with ‘KILL ALL HIPPIES’ on it, and SAM is in PJs. They are pretty drunk. HOLLY has a crappy mini stereo playing tinny surf/punk mu She is smoking a joint and swigging from a hip flask that passes to SAM.
So you go on trips with all these girls before?  18 19 14.
Just once. Juno started them when she was at school in England, and then picked up Rebecca when she moved back here.
Why go on holiday with your sister? You don’t want to meet guys?
Well, I’ve got a guy. HOLLY picks up a photo of her boyfriend which is by the b SAM (cont'd) Have you been to Boreham Caverns?
I see it in a book...
Walking past the bedroom JUNO overhears. HOLLY (0.S.) (cont'd) ...It’s Starbucks, you know - hand rails, tourist things...it’s not adventure. Juno lingers by the door, eavesdropping...
If you are a climber, jumper, caver you have to just do it and not give a fuck or the thing that is bigger than you will get you. SAM pats HOLLY’s hand.
I think that weed might be bigger than you Holly. HOLLY hands the photo back to SAM  20 21 22 23 24 25 15.
You are lucky. He looks like a bad boy.
JUNO walks away looking pissed off, bumping into REBECCA clearly overheard as well.
BETH is asleep. SARAH is in her bed awake, staring, glass
The wind whistles through the trees and the moon lights u night as we

SARAH is still awake. She gets up and goes to look out of window, her eyes straining in the dark. Through the trees can see a flicker of light, a flash of yellow, and on the she hears the giggle of a child. SARAH presses her head a the window, the cold condensation easing the pounding in head and SMASH - A scaffolding pole comes straight through it impaling its her head and spurting blood everywhere!
As she awakens bolt upright in her bed.
Jesus...  26 27 28 29 30 16. She falls back heavily on the pillow.
Very early. The sky is a leaden grey, with a pale yellow on the horizon. All is still.
Feet, jogging. We tilt up to reveal JUNO as she runs to t LODGE, leaps up the steps onto the veranda and into the l
Juno breezes in to her room.
Wakey wakey! REBECCA is sitting up in bed, wearing sunglasses, and loo severely hung-over.
I feel like roadkill. ...Give me five minutes
REBECCA wanders into the bathroom, turns on the shower fu blast and COLD, removes her gown and steps in. She scream
The scream can be heard from next door as BETH stands bef mirror in her bathroom looking rough, checking her bloods eyes. She sticks her tongue out. Checks her breath....It’

We see a foot reflected in the mirror. It lowers and anot comes up. HOLLY the human rubber band is stretching. ANGLE on view from Holly’s bathroom window: JUNO is stret on the porch, lithe and sinuous. But not a rubber band. H watching her. Holly’s face pops up in the mirror, smiling, with first o by her ear -
The Queen is dead... And then the other.
Long live the queen. And she sticks her tongue out at herself in glee.
REBECCA is walking past the door, drying her hair with a as she goes.
Sam, are you up yet? And you ought to eat something. SAM puts the last pieces of equipment in her pack.
(mutters) Its just for the weekend. It’1ll be good for us.
REBECCA walks past sees SARAH knock back some pills and g as she swallows, dry.
HOLLY is at the bottom of the steps, setting up a camera of the JEEPS parked up front.

Alright ladies....group shot! The others begin to assemble on the steps, carrying PACKS with kit. There is an edgy, fragile, hung-over vibe comin everyone except JUNO and HOLLY. BETH comes out last, look pissed off and anxious. REBECCA is fiddling with SAM’S ki SARAH is looking distractedly at the rather jaundiced daw is now breaking. BETH sighs.

She smiles directly at BETH. HOLLY (cont’d) The Americans will find this bit hard: say Liberty! And she runs round to join them... HOLLY (cont’d) Equality! And flings herself into their midst. HOLLY (cont’d)
CLICK, the picture is taken and the image freezes.

Looking out over the vastness of the landscape, WE tilt d gliding above the sprawling canopy of trees until we pick trail of a forest road, following its snake-like course u find TwO 4x4’s making their way into this bleak wildernes

JUNO is driving, with SARAH beside her and BETH in the ba It’s bumpy. SARAH is gazing out of the window, distant, h vision slightly blurred. A streak of yellow out of the corner of her eye - she tur head quickly but there’s nothing there.
REBECCA is driving with SAM beside her and HOLLY filming journey on her CAM-CORDER.
(to Sam) Here, you should drink some water. SAM Grabs the bottle, distracted by fiddling with her pla retro Spiderman watch.

It’s impossible to set the time on this thing; the buttons are too tiny. HOLLY smirks in the back. She finds a mountaineering maga with REBECCA’S name printed on a label on the cover. It’s of glossy crampons, over elaborate tents, geek gear etc.
(to herself) American porn.
So have you done these caves?
No - but they’re level 2, quite safe don’t worry.  41 42 43 20.
I wasn’t.
The only danger is the boredom. Boreham caves, boredom caves
Let’s go off road!
(Looking as if she may be sick) Oh let’s. The 4x4 swerves at speed, turning off the road onto a dir heading deep into the forest.
The second vehicle follows the first, at speed, kicking u cloud of dust as it swerves radically onto the dirt track
JUNO is pushing the vehicle hard as she races through the landscape. SARAH looks a little uneasy about JUNO’s drivi doesn’t say anything.
Are you sure this is the right way?
Been here before Beth? The 4x4 charges round another bend, throwing up dirt in i wake.
We see various shots of the two vehicles driving hard alo rough and ready mountain track. They round a tight bend a
The front wheel of the first 4X4 comes to an abrupt halt.
The second 4x4 bears down upon the first 4x4, veering aro hitting the brakes and skidding in the mud as we
Its occupants lurch forward as they grind to a halt along the first 4x4.
...nice parking
Thanks.
I take it we’re walking from here?

We see a rapid series of shots depicting the women gettin kit together, sorting their packs, picks and boots out. We see JUNO put her CAR KEYS behind the SUN VISOR, before pulling out her own pack and strapping it on.  50 22.
Let’s get moving. We’re running late. She slams the door closed, and as they head off, we look and see a dog-eared PAPERBACK BOOK lying on the seat.
Trekking upward through the forest, led by JUNO. BETH and bring up the rear.
Where’s your whistle? Beth smiles and pulls out an old whistle that is tucked i top, brandishing it with a flourish. She gives it a coupl loud toots and shouts out:
(taking the piss) Hey Juno, you DO know where you’re going don’t you? SARAH laughs.
(terse) There’s a river about half a mile ahead. When we reach it, we follow it up to the mouth of the cave. SAM, near the back, turns to REBECCA.
How does she know there’s a river up ahead? I can’t hear a thing.
(dead pan) She can smell it.
...She came up here last week to check the route out. Rule number one; file a flight plan and stick to it.
And rule number 2?  51 52 53 23.
Don’t go wandering off. You think it’s dark when you turn out the lights? Down there it’s pitch black.
White water crashes down this narrow gully. Rebecca is st lecturing
You can get dehydration disorientation, claustrophobia, panic attacks, paranoia, hallucinations, visual and aural... Sam rolls her eyeballs.

JUNO, up front, pushes through into a clearing. CROWS scatter and burst up into the air in a wild flurry. rotting corpse of a giant ELK lies washed up on the rocks huge bulk deflated and gaunt, its fur matted with blood a HOLLY takes pictures of the dead creature as the others g around, some looking on with interest, others with disgus
Cool, huh?
Lovely. A real Kodak moment. SAM bends down to take a closer look
Don’t touch it!
Yeah. You wouldn’t want to piss it off.
What do you think did that Sam? A bear?  54 55 24. SAM examines it and we see that its eyes are yellow.
Actually, I think it was just sick. SAM (cont’d) Jaundice, dengue fever, yellow fever..there’s all sorts of ways it could have died out here
What is this, Nature Detectives? It could have been Bigfoot for all you know.
Continuing on their trek, they climb up the side of a wat to a rocky area above. Deviating from the course of the r JUNO takes them through a stand of trees.
This is it! Fighting through the heavy foliage, JUNO emerges at the e a great SINKHOLE, a gaping black opening in the ground.
Oh, you are having a laugh!
‘Fraid not.
For Christ’s sake! I’m an English teacher not Tomb Raider. They are high up now, the mountains stretch out behind th
Looking up at the daylight from the depths of the cave, t of three ropes drops toward us, straightening as it comes hitting rock beneath us.

All six women are fully kitted out. Some are wearing warm figure hugging climbing tops and leggings. JUNO is wearin wet-suit top with the arms cut off. They have lamps on th helmets, extra torches in their packs, along with flares, food and water and their PICKS. JUNO is ready to go down and leans back over the brink.
I’1l go first. I’1l see you down there. Turning on her HEADLAMP she drops away into the unknown.

With the beam of her lamp flashing this way and that, JUN descends a hundred feet or more into the cavern, before f hitting rock bottom. Unhooking herself from the rope she around with a child-like glee before calling up to the ot
You’ve got to see this place It’s beautiful! Her voice echoes and resonates about the massive chamber. looks around, awestruck. Now she is truly in her element.
REBECCA double checks SARAH and BETH’s harnesses and they down together, side by side.  26.
Oh shit, oh shit, oh shit!
Coming down the rope, SARAH looks around in amazement bef landing safely near JUNO. BETH is just behind her...
You can open your eyes now, Beth.
Oh my God! TI had no idea it would be like this!
It’s incredible. Incredible. JUNO smiles in quiet satisfaction as from high above come loud WHOOP! They look up as we
REBECCA looks down on US as we descend into the cave!

HOLLY comes down the rope at high speed, her CAM-CORDER a to her helmet, howling all the way! At the last moment sh herself and lands like a cat in front of JUNO and SARAH SARAH shakes her head in dismay as JUNO steps in
(angry) Holly, this isn’t some MTV bungee jump bullshit. We do this safely. In order. Following my lead.
(to REBECCA) All clear!
Rebecca fusses over Sam’s harness. SAM drops down and REB follows her over the brink.

REBECCA overtakes SAM and lands softly, unhooking herself the rope before SAM lands beside her. HOLLY is filming th with her CAMCORDER. JUNO stands beneath a steady drip of water, the light fro surface shining down on her upturned face, soaking her br

Sarah? SARAH is looking at what appears to be recent scratch mar the side of the rock, as if some animal had fallen into t cavern and was making a desperate attempt to claw its way to the surface. Her attention is drawn to a dark crevice cave wall, from which a quiet chirping noise is coming. S moves closer to the hole, listening carefully.

Guys, I think I’ve found a bird’s nest! The others turn to her as SARAH turns her attention back HOLE, aiming her TORCHBEAM into the shadows. Suddenly, th erupts with BATS! Hundreds of them, swarming out and arou very panicky SARAH. A hand grabs her and pulls her clear. Juno, nonplussed by the BATS.
It’s Okay...they’re gone now.
Are you sure?
Take a look for yourself. SARAH looks upwards to see the BATS swirling around the f of the cave entrance in an elegant spiral. After the shoc an eerie yet beautiful sight.
The butterflies of the night...  28.
Oh fuck off Holly. From a high vantage point, we watch the group make their downwards, into the cave.
Which way?
Only one way out of this chamber. Down the pipe.
Water dripping from the rocks all around the ENTRANCE CAV gathers at its lowest point and flows into a crack in the floor. This is where our intrepid CAVERS must go.
They are in a narrow, vertical shaft with plenty of footh all the way down. The water drips heavily down the side o shaft, as the women head deeper into the mountain.

Further down the tunnel levels off to a shallow downward With each step the tunnel randomly fluctuates in size and sometimes it’s tall and very thin, sometimes it’s wide an so that they must stoop or even crawl to pass through, an the way water drips from the roof above their heads.
How are you feeling?
Exhausted. But don’t tell Rebecca. They laugh together as we
We see various shots of the group making their way deeper deeper into the cave system until at last they emerge int vast chamber and we

....For THIS we need a little more light on the subject. JUNO takes out one of the many PHOSPHOROUS FLARES they ha lights it up. Now the chamber is filled with a hot white throwing hard shadows of countless stalactites across the The roof and floor of this new cavern are littered with g stalagmites and stalactites, pillars of rock formed over millions of years; sediment building upward and downward some of them bridge the entire cap. The colour of the new is yellow with sulphur and red with iron. The entire cham an amazing spectacle. The group spread out as they enter this grand subterranea cathedral, almost gothic in its design, each of them eage explore their own corner of the cave. From a HIGH LEDGE, we look down on the group, spread arou chamber: Six individual pools of light, moving here and t In the centre, the FLARE burns steadily. In the right foreground, we become aware that what we tho was a rock, is in fact something else, SOMETHING ALIVE, m slightly. Breathing. Watching.
Five members of the group are having a bite to eat and so to drink as HOLLY snaps away with her camera beyond them. JUNO (cont’d) Holly, take a break, you should eat!
I’m just getting a couple more shots. This cave is cooler than I thought.  30.
(to Sarah) ...You okay?
Juno. I won’t break.

(quietly) I know... I wanted to say - there’s nothing I can say. But I’m sorry I didn’t stay around longer. After the accident. She sighs, its the first time we’ve seen her anything oth in control. JUNO (cont'd) I’m bad with that stuff. And Paul...You know.
And Jessie... SARAH and JUNO share a look...
We’re all here for you now.
...I’m sorry. I’m a bit out of it...It’s probably jet-lag or something. SARAH gets up.
I’m going to have a look around.
See if you can find the way through.
(calling out) Don’t go too far. SARAH picks up her torch and moves past HOLLY, who has be observing her and JUNO’s exchange.
...She flips out?  70 31.
She’s fine.
After the crash she broke down pretty badly. Spent months in hospital. She was a mess. Couldn’t find a reason to get up in the mornings.
Well, I guess she found one if she’s here.

Elsewhere in the cavern, SARAH skirts the bright light so the flare, moving among the harsh shadows of stalactite a stalagmites it creates. The sound of water dripping echoe around her, the voices of the others are a murmur. She is in her surroundings, fascinated by the cave. SARAH hears a noise, she spins and aims her TORCH. A rock from a ledge and bounces down scree slope, clattering to ground. SARAH, moves forward investigating, curious. There is an in the cave wall. SARAH listens, intent - the sound of la
SARAH appears suddenly at JUNO’s shoulder, startling her.
I think I’ve found the way.
At the far end of the chamber, the walls converge to meet base of a small heap of scree. At the top of the scree is narrow fissure. It is into this that the women must now g gather before the scree.
I don’t understand - it’s not how imagined it from reading the book.
Caves change, tunnels collapse, some of this debris looks recent.  32.
Well then should we be going through?
I’m telling you, it’s a tight squeeze for about a hundred feet and then...
Then what?
Then it opens out into a wider passage.
If you say so. It’s your party.
Something wrong?
It’s nothing. ...Where’s Sam?

I don’t know, she was here a minute ago... SAM? And again, that giggle, high pitched, child like. She loo around but its clear the others haven’t heard. The others spread out and look for her, calling for Sam. echoes bounce back. After a tense moment, a voice comes f behind a rock.
I’M BUSY! The group all laugh at SAM’S predicament
I made her drink loads of water this morning...
I’1l wait for her. HOLLY worms her way ahead in front of JUNO
I will take point yes?  71 72 73 74 33. HOLLY discards a half-eaten CANDY BAR and heads into the hooked onto a rope, which JUNO feeds in after her.
HOLLY edges further and further into the fissure. As the funnel inward, she must first stoop, then crawl, then lie and wriggle into this tiny passageway through the rock.
Phut! It’s tight crack in here. BETH looks apprehensive as she shines her torch along the crawl-way.

HOLLY crawls head first through this intensely claustroph passage, barely big enough for her to move, contorting he through the most awkward spaces imaginable. Slowly but su she edges through, until at last the CRAWL SPACE opens ou she emerges in another tunnel, this time with high slopin and a sloping floor running diagonally along its length. HOLLY quickly turns about and part-crawls back into the H
OK I’m through!
How far?
Maybe 100-150 feet..
Close enough?  75 76 77 78 34.
....Close enough. JUNO heads into the fissure as REBECCA turns to the other REBECCA (cont’d) Alright. Sam you’re up next...
We see each character’s progress through a difficult and constrictive space. JUNO is next through, then SAM, then REBECCA, then BETH and finally SARAH, bringing up the rea
The FLARE burns in the background as, in the immediate foreground, a silhouetted hand, humanoid, reaches down an up the half eaten CANDY BAR. Off screen, whatever it is, the CANDY and we
JUNO crawls out to join HOLLY, then helps SAM out.
REBECCA squeezes through the tightest part, not noticing dust falling from the rock above. BETH is next through. It’s very tight, but she makes it. dust falls from the rocks above her head.
Sarah, you still behind me?

(breathing hard) I think so...  79 80 35. SARAH seems to be having more difficulty than the others is the most uncomfortable in such a claustrophobic enviro Still, she shuffles along as best she can until she reach point at which, to get through, her head must twist to on and half submerge in a pool of muddy water. It is here th wedges herself stuck and can no longer move forward. The she fights, the more dust falls down from the roof inches her head, hitting her face. SARAH (cont’d) Shit. ....Shit! At first she’s just agitated and annoyed, but soon she be panic. She begins to breathe heavily and fast, the muddy getting in her mouth.
Sarah?
(getting desperate) I can’t move!
REBECCA is pulled out as JUNO begins to explore the caver are in.....
BETH stops, waiting for SARAH..
It’s Sarah. I think she might be stuck.
There’s no ‘might be’ about it. ..Fuck! FUCK! FUCK!
Alright Sarah....Calm down. Breathe slowly. You have to relax.
I can’t fucking relax!  81 82 36.
(slow and calming) Sarah....Listen to me. You have to calm down. The only way you can do that is to breathe slowly...

(panicking, hyperventilating) I’ve got a million tons of rock above my head! How the fuck am I supposed to calm down?! I can’t fucking BREATHE! The more she struggles, the more dust rains down on her. in a wider part of the fissure, manages to turn herself a and crawls back toward SARAH.
Sarah, just listen to me, okay, listen to my voice....
HOLLY, at the far end, wants to know what’s keeping every
It’s okay down there?
(calling back) We’re fine. Just give us a minute.

BETH, now face to face with SARAH, continues to try and c SARAH down as her panic attack grows more desperate. She splutters and gags with the mud in her mouth and writhes the rock, wedging herself even further. BETH can see the dust falling from the rock above and kno danger SARAH is in. She focuses completely on her, soothi magnetic:
Sarah listen to me. What are you afraid of?  37.
(agitated) I can’t move...
You can. You can move. It’s in your head.
I know, I know, but I can’t stop it.
Sarah, the worst thing that can happen to you has already happened. SARAH, despite herself, is distracted...
It’s over. And you’re here. You didn’t give up. This is just a poxy little cave. You’ve got NOTHING left to be afraid of. SARAH begins to calm down...
Sarah?
Yeah?
